ygData.subject: Re: [neat] Thoughts and tips applying NEAT to OpenAI's Environments

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

> Thanks for the link to the paper, Dr. Clune. I'll definitely read it.
> 
=

Great. I hope you find it interesting. 

> >It would be fascinating to see=
 a comparison between evolutionary and DeepRL methods on these domains. It =
sounds like your sense is that NEAT and HyperNEAT are not competitive with =
DeepRL methods, is that right?
> 
> Nooo, I didn't want to come off that wa=
y at all. I don't expect evolutionary algorithms to compete face to face wi=
th DeepRL methods like A3C or DQN. The reason being that they are tackling =
different problems. It's actually kind of disappointing that many will brus=
h of EAs because they don't perform as well as X on Y domain. I personally =
see EAs as so much more and especially as a tool for discovering new archit=
ectures.
> 
> As far as comparisons with DeepRL go on openai, you can clear=
ly see that evolutionary algorithms aren't as high performance and it's obv=
ious that evolution would have a hard time competing against backprop.
> 
>=
 
> Dr. Stanley has alluded that EAs are only part of picture, which I agre=
e with. Would I be wrong in assuming you feel the same way?
> 
No, you woul=
d not be wrong. :)

> What I'm interested in is merging EAs with online lea=
rning rules. Some of the work done with adaptive Hebbian weights is awesome=
. I'm interested in using STDP rules on large evolved spiking nets. I wonde=
r what the result would be like. You are all probably aware of Hinton's tal=
k where he argues STDP is how the brain "does backprop".  There is some exc=
iting work going on in this area, like this object recognition task: https:=
//www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Du32Xnz2hDkE <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3D=
u32Xnz2hDkE>. Maybe some will say this is too Numenta-like but there are su=
btle differences.
> 
> 
> 
> I hope research continues in that area as well=
 as in novelty search and I look forward to new publications that your grou=
p will be releasing.
> 

Thanks. You too. Please post your papers here as t=
hey come out!

> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_6097BFD9-27CE-43A5-9294-1DD80DC7B1FC
